clinical_question: What are the effects of non–vitamin K antagonist oral anticoagulants (NOACs) (also known as direct-acting oral anticoagulants [DOACs]) with or without warfarin compared with placebo or warfarin alone among people with CKD and atrial fibrillation in terms of stroke and bleeding risks?
population: Adults and/or children with CKD and atrial fibrillation
intervention: NOAC/DOAC (dabigatran, apixaban, edoxaban, rivaroxaban) with warfarin and NOAC/DOAC alone
outcome: Any stroke (follow-up: range 1.9 years to 2.8 years)

Imprecision.rationales: The total number of events among the 6083 participants of the 4 trials was estimated to be less than the number needed to reach the optimal information size (i.e., 300). One study did not report the number of events (Hori 2013).

Other considerations.rationales: Only some of the 7 studies reported on outcome.

clinical_question: What are the effects of non–vitamin K antagonist oral anticoagulants (NOACs) (also known as direct-acting oral anticoagulants [DOACs]) with or without warfarin compared with placebo or warfarin alone among people with CKD and atrial fibrillation in terms of stroke and bleeding risks?
population: Adults and/or children with CKD and atrial fibrillation
intervention: NOAC/DOAC (dabigatran, apixaban, edoxaban, rivaroxaban) with warfarin and NOAC/DOAC alone
outcome: Ischemic stroke (follow-up: range 1.8 years to 2.8 years)

Imprecision.rationales: The total number of events among the participants of the 5 trials was estimated to be less than the number needed to reach the optimal information size (i.e., 300). The number of events and the number of participants were not always reported.

clinical_question: What are the effects of non–vitamin K antagonist oral anticoagulants (NOACs) (also known as direct-acting oral anticoagulants [DOACs]) with or without warfarin compared with placebo or warfarin alone among people with CKD and atrial fibrillation in terms of stroke and bleeding risks?
population: Adults and/or children with CKD and atrial fibrillation
intervention: NOAC/DOAC (dabigatran, apixaban, edoxaban, rivaroxaban) with warfarin and NOAC/DOAC alone
outcome: Hemorrhagic stroke (follow-up: range 1.9 years to 2.8 years)

Imprecision.rationales: The total number of events among the 6083 participants of the 4 trials was estimated to be less than the number needed to reach the optimal information size (i.e., 300). One study did not report the number of events (Hori 2013).

Other considerations.rationales: Only some of the 7 studies reported on outcome.
